titleStmt.title: The Nationall Assembly of Scotland, with the oath taken by the Parliament men, &c. Printed at Edinburgh, by James Bryson, 1641. Whereunto is annexed his most gracious Majesties speech, to the Parliament of Scotland, the 17. of August. 1641.
In the Nationall Assemblie at Edinburgh the fourth day of August, 1641
titleStmt.author: Church of Scotland. General Assembly.

titleStmt.title: The Nationall Assembly of Scotland, with the oath taken by the Parliament men, &c. Printed at Edinburgh, by James Bryson, 1641. Whereunto is annexed his most gracious Majesties speech, to the Parliament of Scotland, the 17. of August. 1641.
In the Nationall Assemblie at Edinburgh the fourth day of August, 1641
titleStmt.author: Church of Scotland. General Assembly.
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I). aut
Scotland. Parliament.

notesStmt.note: Previously published with title: "In the nationall assemblie ..".

Thomason E.199[10] has caption title: "In the National Assembly at Edinburgh, the 4. day of August, 1641.". Thomason E.199[11] has caption title: "The oath to be taken by all members of the Parliament, 1641..". Thomason E.199[12] has caption title: "The Kings speech to the Parliament of Scotland, the 17. of August, 1641.".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
